action.action-desc: Mr. Neugebauer (for himself, Mr. Huizenga of Michigan, Mr. Nunnelee, Mr. Farenthold, Mr. Massie, Mr. Jones, Mr. Boustany, Mr. Rothfus, Mr. Cartwright, Mr. Pompeo, Mr. Messer, Mr. Harper, Mr. Nugent, Mr. Miller of Florida, Mr. Pearce, Mr. Long, and Mr. Lipinski) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Education and the Workforce

form.official-title: To amend the General Education Provisions Act to prohibit Federal education funding for elementary schools and secondary schools that provide on-campus access to abortion providers.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Protecting Life in Funding Education Act or the PRO-LIFE Act.
The General Education Provisions Act (20 U.S.C. 1221 et seq.) is amended by adding at the end the following new part:

subsection.text: Notwithstanding any other provision of law, no funds shall be made available under any applicable program to any State educational agency or local educational agency that enters into a contract or other agreement with a school-based health center relating to the provision of health services to students served by the agency unless such center certifies that—

paragraph.text: the center will not perform an abortion; and
the center will not provide abortion-related materials, referrals, or directions for abortion services to any such student.

subsection.text: Nothing in this part shall be construed to prevent a school-based health center from providing non-abortion health services to pregnant students.

paragraph.text: The terms local educational agency and State educational agency have the meanings given the terms in section 9101 of the Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965 (20 U.S.C. 7801).
The term school-based health center has the meaning given such term in section 2110(c)(9) of the Social Security Act (42 U.S.C. 1397jj(c)(9)).
